poem:
**Greenland**

The big man wakes, and the map  
becomes a hunger.  
Greenland—white silence—  
he would buy, bless, seize,  
as if snow were obedience.

Across the sea the patriots  
hear the old word: sovereignty,  
and it cuts their cheering.  
Alliances are thin ice;  
they shift, and the loud foot  
finds water.

The divide could jeopardise the goals of his administration’s national security strategy, which set a US policy objective of “cultivating resistance” to Europe’s “current trajectory” by working with “patriotic allies” to avert “civilisational erasure”. Just over a year ago, Europe’s far-right leaders were effusively welcoming Trump’s return to the White House.
